t: Nahum 1
The*p pronouncement concerning Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
God’s Vengeance
The*pn Lord*s is a jealous and avenging God; the*ln Lord*s takes vengeance and*ln is fierce in wrath. The*ln Lord*s takes vengeance against his foes; he*ln is furious with his enemies.
The*ln Lord*s is slow to anger but great in power; the*ln Lord*s will never leave the guilty unpunished. His*ln path is in the whirlwind and storm, and*ln clouds are the dust beneath his feet.
He*ln rebukes the sea and dries it up, and*ln he makes all the rivers run dry. Bashan*ln and Carmel wither; even*ln the flower of Lebanon withers.
The*ln mountains quake before him, and*ln the hills melt; the*ln earth trembles at his presence — the*ln world and all who live in it.
Who*ln can withstand his indignation? Who*ln can endure his burning anger? His*ln wrath is poured out like fire; even*ln rocks are shattered before him.
Destruction of Nineveh
The*pn Lord*s is good, a*ln stronghold in a day of distress; he*ln cares for those who take refuge in him.
But*ln he will completely destroy Nineveh with*ln an overwhelming flood, and*ln he will chase his enemies into darkness.
Whatever*pn you plot against the Lord,*s he*ln will bring it to complete destruction; oppression*ln will not rise up a second time.
For*ln they will be consumed like*ln entangled thorns, like*ln the drink of a drunkard and*ln like straw that is fully dry.
One*ln has gone out from you, who*ln plots evil against the Lord,*s and*ln is a wicked counselor.
Promise of Judah’s Deliverance
This*p is what the Lord*s says: Though*pn they are strong and numerous, they*ln will still be mowed down, and*ln he will pass away. Though*ln I have punished you, I*ln will punish you no longer.
For*ln I will now break off his yoke from you and*ln tear off your shackles.
The Assyrian King’s Demise

The*p Lord*s has issued an order concerning you: There*pn will be no offspring to*ln carry on your name. I*ln will eliminate the carved idol and cast image from*ln the house of your gods; I*ln will prepare your grave, for*ln you are contemptible.

Look*pn to the mountains — the*ln feet of the herald, who*ln proclaims peace. Celebrate*ln your festivals, Judah; fulfill*ln your vows. For*ln the wicked one will never again march*ln through you; he*ln will be entirely wiped out.
